content:
hey :wave: a note about the perf. reporting. like pnkfelix mentioned today, they are a bit verbose in a time-contrained meeting
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bweekly.20meeting.5D.202021-01-07.20.2354818/near/221954257

I was wondering where I can cut when doing copy and paste (it's me, I usually grab them from the repo and slap them into the agenda).

Example, would it make sense if I only get:

  • the initial abstract
  • titles of the improvements+mixed
  • the "nags" in full (because they may contain issues to be discussed)
rendered version of what could today's perf.report look like
(ofc people can refer to the full version on the git repo)
Regressions are more important in my view than improvements. You'll want to grab those.
but ... yeah this is just a vague proposal :)

rylev said:

Regressions are more important in my view than improvements. You'll want to grab those.

ah right of course :thumbs_up:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-perf/blob/9c4eebfdf2c1a9933f318735697dd463a7cefe44/triage/weekly_report.py#L38
